meanings.definition: To surpass or outdo in a competition or contest.
meanings.sent1: In the race, Sarah managed to outtrump all her competitors.
meanings.sent2: The team's hard work helped them outtrump the other teams in the tournament.
meanings.sent3: John's determination to outtrump his opponents in the chess match was evident.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to practice every day allowed her to outtrump her own previous record.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's incredible speed and agility enabled him to outtrump everyone else in the race.

meanings.definition: To defeat or outwit someone in a game or argument.
meanings.sent1: She used her clever strategy to outtrump her opponent in the chess game.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer's sharp wit helped him outtrump the opposing counsel in the courtroom.
meanings.sent3: The siblings always try to outtrump each other in friendly board game competitions.
meanings.sent4: His ability to outtrump his rivals in debates earned him the title of champion debater.
meanings.sent5: The detective's keen observation skills allowed him to outtrump the criminal's plan.
